title: Couch Games
description: This is a project was my first website. A video game recommendation website that helps players discover new games tailored to their tastes. Find personalized game suggestions, reviews, and ratings across all genres and platforms.

title: PyPlatformmer
description: In this Python platformer, you play as a pirate jumping on enemies and collecting treasures. I used Pygame to implement mechanics like jumping, collision detection, and user input. This project helped me improve my Python skills and learn 2D game design and game state management.

title: Link Far From Home
description: In this 2D platformer, you control Link as he navigates through challenging levels to save the kingdom. Armed only with his sword, he must jump and fight enemies while exploring vibrant environments. This is an improvement from what I learned from the Python Platformer.

title: Ayo's Weather App
description: The weather app provides real-time weather updates, including current conditions, forecasts, and temperature details, tailored to your location. I learned how to make a PWA using html, css, and javascript.

title: Mario RL Model
description: This project uses reinforcement learning to train an AI to play Super Mario Bros. Using Python and RL libraries, the model learns by trial and error to improve its gameplay. I gained experience with RL, and training AI agents in dynamic environments.

title: CodeCademy
description: A slideshow presentation on about me using Codecademy to learn TypeScript and SQL. It covers key features, learning paths, and how these skills can enhance web development and data management capabilities for beginners and experienced coders alike.

title: Careers with AI
description: This is a slideshow presentation about my research on a career in the tech field and how it's affected or how it's going to be affected by AI. The career that I based my research on was a Cybersecurity Engineer.

title: Mario RL Model DFDs
description: This project is a data flow diagram of the Mario reinforcement model AI with 3 different levels. The level 1 DFD covers level 1-1 and the detailed mechanics of how the game functions. There is a level 0 is a simple overview of the game and level 2 is the functionality of the AI.

title: Classroom Simulation
description: This application is a 3D classroom tour of Saltfleet's computer science classroom. This program uses unity and C#, and is almost a 1 to 1 recreation of the classroom. They are a wide variety of interactable objects such as chairs, stools, utility cars.

title: Fight or Flight
description: This game is an airplane simulator with two levels: Explore and Mission. This game was created with unity and C#. The game uses realsitic plane physics by using components like lift, drag, G-force, angle of attack and altitude.
